pr_title: Support multiple Hibernate ORM persistence units via Quarkus configuration

timeline.message:

consistent and see how it goes.

Throw an exception if storage engine configuration is not consistent

In passing, reorganize the dialect configuration to work around an issue
with SmallRye Config.
fix: make sure that config section within the same config root are merged properly
fix: generate unique anchors for ConfigSection fom section title and section key
Enable scanning in JPA tests as we enforce it now
Prepare configuration for multiple persistence units support
Support defining the datasource used by a persistence unit
Add config for multiple persistence units

Rename the default persistence unit to "<default>"

It has a special meaning and I don't want it to conflict with the user
defined ones.
Make archives containing entity packages part of the Jandex index

Reorganize HibernateOrmProcessor a bit

No code changes, just moving methods around.

In passing, we now make JTA the only case handled.
I will throw a proper error in a follow-up commit when not enabled.

Make JPAConfig less brittle and also publish the entity -> PUs mapping

I decided to support multiple PUs there. We will see how it goes in
Panache.
Move PersistenceUnitUtil to the runtime module

Throw an exception if no JTA

Sanne confirmed that not having JTA around is not a valid configuration.
We used to have some partial support for it but it was buggy at best.

The support was removed in a previous commit, this commit only adds a
proper exception for it.

timeline.bodyText: Just curious, did you figure that this was necessary?
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: It's not necessary as you forced it in LightPersistence... but... I'm not sure we will keep it that way so wanted to be extra sure it wouldn't break if we change it later.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Ok, thanks I was just puzzled.
replies.author: Sanne

timeline.bodyText: What do you mean by "has special meaning", is it not possible for a user to speficy this name explicitly?
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: The idea was to avoid a conflict between the default one and a potential named PU called "default". Thus why I added the special characters. Also, it's consistent with the Agroal extension.
replies.author: gsmet

timeline.bodyText:
is this condition check useful? I was assuming that unitName would be always defined, at most <default>.
If I'm wrong, we might want to improve the following (nested) if so that the default can still be used/injected even when there's more than one PU defined.
timeline.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText: It's always set except when you're explicitly calling null. This was the case somewhere in the code base so I decided to make it null safe just to be on the safe side.
replies.author: gsmet

replies.bodyText: Ok, it feels a bit smelly but we can clean it up later.
replies.author: Sanne

replies.bodyText:
I would call it safe not smelly. I'm not sure I understand your problem.
Everything is working fine with the default injection, we have tests for that. The null test is there just if someone calls it programmatically. When dealing with injection, you pass the default unit name (which is not null).
For me passing null is not really valid, I only support it because someone used it (and I changed that call to not use it) and I thought maybe someone else could have.
replies.author: gsmet
